Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2011 08:57AM Herky wrote: Hey everyone! I had my BMX on the 9th and today I'm feeling great because I got those dastardly drains out! I feel like a new woman! Everything else feels good - I got great results from the pathology report and now will have to meet with a few different docs to determine if I'll need radiation because there was only a small margin between the DCIS and the pectoral muscle. I'm hoping I won't need radiation, but I guess I'll have to do what I have to do. I hope you are all doing well and healing nicely - best wishes!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 2, 2011 08:28PM Herky wrote: Thanks for the post, mdg! I'm glad to hear you are recovering well, and your tips are great! I'm going to use your supply list to go shopping before my surgery (I'm having a BMX with TE on 2/9). I guess constipation is a problem with surgery in general because I was the same way after my c-sections. Prune juice helps alot too - just don't drink too much of it! Also, my PS said to get a wedge pillow with arms so you can keep your arms slightly elevated - I found one online at Target for about $20, so I'm going to give that a try. Best of luck to everyone!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2011 10:06PM Herky wrote: I'm considering getting one of these while I'm waiting for my reconstruction . . . http://www.baronbob.com/winerack-winegaggift.htm  I had all three drains out 10 days post-op - one hurt like crazy when it came out but the pain only lasted 30 seconds. I barely felt anything when they pulled out the other thing. I was also fortunate that volunteers at the hospital made pouches that went around my neck and held the drains so I could take a shower with them. The best part about this has been seeing how many people I don't even know have taken the time to do something nice that has made this all just a little bit easier. I only hope that when I'm feeling up to it I'm able to return the favor.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2011 11:31AM Herky wrote: Well, I saw the radiation oncologist yesterday and they do not recommend radiation for me. I have mixed feelings about it. I really didn't want radiation, but want to do everything I can to reduce my risk of coming back. They said my risk of recurrence wasn't very high (maybe 4-6%), and they wanted to have the option of doing radiation in the future if I should have a recurrence. Everything was non-invasive, so they won't do any chemo and I'm ER/PR negative, so no hormone therapy either. So I guess that's it for me - other than reconstruction. It's so weird. This all happened so fast - everything since my mammogram on 1/7/11 - that it's like I'm just now starting to process all of it. I feel guilty for not having to have to go through chemo and radiation like so many others. Like I don't deserve to be considered a cancer survivor because I don't belong in the same category as all of the strong women who have endured so much and are going through so much now. I have decided that there are many more positives than negatives to come from all this though. Yes, I lost my breasts and I've had the pain from surgery and recovery, not to mention a very stressful few months waiting to figure out my final diagnosis and treatment, but I've also become closer to my husband, closer to my mother who has breast cancer, closer to my sister who traveled half way across the country to take care of me and my two little girls for 10 days while I recovered from surgery, and closer to my friends who steped up to support and help me and my family. I've had strangers reach out to me and help me and my family through this and I'll never forget their kindness. I've met some wonderful women on this forum that have comforted me and educated me more that I could have ever imagined. I've made new friends that I hope to have for a lifetime. I feel like I owe a debt - a huge one - and I owe it to all who have come before me and all who will come after. Now I need to find a way to pay it back.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2011 03:22PM Herky wrote: AnnaM - as sweet as your offer is, I think you may have meant it for XMasDX, as I'm done with drains(thank GOD!) - but thanks anyways!! Cameron - Thanks for the advice. I was a bit worried about picking her up but got the ok from my PS before doing so. I've been taking it easy and only lift her when I have to and only for short periods of time (like just to get her into her high chair or into bed). I still have lots of help around the house, so I really don't do it unless I have to. XmasDX - congrats on your surgery. I had orignally planned on having my DH go home for the night, but once I realized that I couldn't reach anything or pick anything up myself I quickly changed my mind. It's good advice no matter what unit you're in to have someone stay the night if possible.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2011 09:14AM Herky wrote: I'm with you, suefly. F-it and let's get it over with! I'm scheduled for a BMX with SNB and immediate reconstruction on Feb. 9th. I'm really not looking forward to the drains. I hear that's the most annoying part. I get grossed out really easy, too. I've already told my husband he's in charge of having to empty them. Ick! I hate to see so many people on here having to go through this, but I'm so thankful for this forum and to know that I'm not going through it alone! My thoughts are with all of you!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2011 01:24AM Herky wrote: Rowan: I'm three weeks out and I'm able to lift my one year old who weighs 20lbs, if that helps. As far as typing goes, I was apparently sending emails to people a few days after surgery, but I don't remember it. I only know from looking through my inbox. :) I highly recommend the getaway with your husband. My husband and I already had a trip planned when I was diagnosed and were going to cancel it, but I'm so glad we didn't. Went to Vegas for a few days and I was actually able to take my mind off of everything for a few days. Best of luck to you!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2011 01:54PM Herky wrote: Hey ladies - hope everyone is doing well. I had my first fill today. Just 60cc's in each side but every little bit helps! Meeting with the radiation oncologist tomorrow to discuss whether or not I need radiation. Always looking forward to getting more information. I still feel like I have a ton of questions. JackieMom - you're totally on point with the prune juice. It doesn't taste as bad when it's really cold, either.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2011 01:17PM Herky wrote: AHHHHHHHHH! Tomorrow's my day. You're right, Cameron, the 9th is doozy! :) In a way I'm looking forward to it - I just wanted to get it done and over with and find out the final pathology. Thanks to all those who have posted their experiences - it helps knowing what to expect. I wish everyone a speedy recovery and I'll be thinking of you all. Now I'm off to clean my house - hey I know no one else cares, but it makes me feel good to know my toliets are clean!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2011 12:45PM Herky wrote: Well, I had my surgery on Wednesday an so far it hasn't been that bad. I didn't  have any nausea afterwards because the anesthesiologist said he would be pretty aggressive about it. He gave me meds through the IV and a patch behind my ear and I never threw up or even felt like I was going to. The doctor did an SNB and only removed two nodes which both cam back negative, so I'm really excited about that. I shoud get results from the final pathology on Monday. All in all, I"m feeling pretty good and I'm able to get up and walk around as I feel like it. Wishing you all the best! Rennasaus - I'm with you on the bras - before all this I went to Victoria's Secret and bought several different colors and styes. Seems like such a waste!
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2011 10:43AM Herky wrote: Well ladies, I had my BMX with SNB and TE done on the 9th and was discharged on the 10th. I found out while I was still in the hospital that the nodes were clean and that he only removed 3 which was great. I got the phone call yesterday that the pathology was finished and that it was ALL DCIS! Couldn't have asked for a better result! There was a narrow margin near the pectoral muscle and I'll have to get some other opinions as to whether it would be  a good idea to do radiation or something in that area just to be safe, but for the most part I'm done. Just need to do the reconstruction and move on. I keep feeling like I have to find some sort of positive out of this. Like I need to use this experience to help someone else. Anyone else feel that way too?
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT

Posts.Content: Mar 1, 2011 01:00AM Herky wrote: Well, it's the last day of the month and I know there are a few ladies left to go today - good luck to you girls! I really hope everyone is doing well and making it through this month. Next month will be better, right? Personally, I'm just happy to have it over with. I had a wonderful sister that lives out of town come stay with me for the past 10 days and it has been such a blessing - so sad to see her leave today though. Her presence really helped heal me inside and out. Anyways, does anyone else totally not remember anything from the first week? At the time I thought and felt I was totally lucid, but now don't remember anything. Like my husband keeps telling me about all these friends that stopped over to drop off food and I seriously don't remember them even being here, let alone talking to them. Strangely, I do remember eating the food. LOL. I also don't remember much about the hospital stay except that my husband brought me Twizzlers (my favorite treat) and I kept falling asleep while eating them. There were several occasions where I'd wake up with a half eaten Twizzler in my hand and partially chewed Twizzler in my mouth. Horrible. Once a nurse came in and woke me up to take my vitals and couldn't take my temp because I had a Twizzler in my mouth. I also didn't remember my husband staying the night with me at the hospital - I swore I sent him home. I apparently flashed my sister and made her look at the stiches when I first saw her - who knows who else I did that to! I think I may have some apology emails to write.
Posts.Title: February 2011 Mastectomy texasrose361 TinaT
